fields.description:
G++ has a built-in compiler flag to check code against the Google standards:

http://cpptruths.blogspot.com/2006/08/g-compiler-option-weffc.html

To use on Windows:

# Install the G++ compiler (notes here https://github.com/cpluspluscom/ChessPlusPlus/wiki/MinGW-Build-Tutorial)
# Generate new build files with cmake: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4101456/running-cmake-on-windows
fields.summary: Windows: Check source code against "EffectiveC++" measurements
